title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 901.14 - Acquisition of control of the operator of a life care community
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 901.14 - Acquisition of control of the operator of a life care community

State Regulations
(a) (1)

Any change in the controlling person(s)
of the operator of a not-for-profit or proprietary life care community, other
than a change subject to prior approval pursuant to sections
901.12
and
901.13
of this Part, shall be
subject to the approval of the council. A person seeking approval as a
controlling person of the operator of a life care community shall file an
application for the council's approval within 30 days of becoming a controlling
person, in accordance with the applicable requirements of this Part. (2)

Pending a decision by the council, an
applicant shall refrain from exercising control over the life care community by
directing or causing the direction of the actions, management or policies of
the community whether through voting securities or voting rights thereunder, electing or appointing directors, the direct or indirect determination of
policies, or otherwise. The applicant shall submit, as part of the application, an affidavit whereby the applicant affirms that control over the community will
not be exercised pending a decision by the council. (b) If the council disapproves an application
the applicant shall divest himself or herself of the controlling interest over
the operator of the life care community within 30 days of the council's final
decision. (c) Notwithstanding any
other provision of this section, the prior approval of the council must be
obtained if a person who proposes to become a controlling person of the
operator of a life care community is not able to refrain from exercising
control over the community upon becoming a controlling person as required by
subdivision (a) of this section. (d) (1)

Upon request of any person, the commissioner, on behalf of the council, may
issue a determination that the taking of some control action or proposed
control action by the person does not constitute the applicant becoming a
controlling person of the operator of a life care community and that council
approval is not required. (2)

The
commissioner may revoke or modify his determination that a person is not or
will not become a controlling person when, based on additional information or
documentation not provided to the commissioner at the time of his initial
determination, it is found that the person will exercise or has exercised
control over the operator of a life care community to the extent of directing
or causing the direction of the action, management or policies of the operator
of such community. (3)

When the
commissioner determines that a person will exercise or is exercising control
over an operator of a life care community as a controlling person, such person
shall refrain from exercising or continuing to exercise such control until
council approval is obtained. Notes
